etymology.description: 食(食) (shí, "food") + 反(反) (fǎn, "opposite") = concept of food -> meal
etymology.interpretation: This character combines 食(食) (shí, "food"), representing the semantic element, with 反(反) (fǎn, "opposite"), representing the phonetic element. This creates the idea of a meal, associated with food consumption.
etymology.simplification: 饭(飯): Simplified by replacing 食(食) (shí, "food") with the simpler radical 饣(饣) (shí, "food") for easier handwriting.

examples.chinese: 我做好饭(我做好飯)，大家都很开心(大家都很開心)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuò hǎo fàn, dàjiā dōu hěn kāixīn.
examples.english: I cooked the meal well, and everyone was very happy.
The aroma of the meal fills the room.
